In a volume that is penetrating, introspective, incisive, and laugh-out-loud funny, one of the great men of letters of this ageâ€“or any ageâ€“holds forth on life, art, sex, politics, and the state of Americaâ€™s soul. From his coming of age in America, to his formative war experiences, to his life as an artist, this is Vonnegut doing what he does best: Being himself. Whimsically illustrated by the author, A Man Without a Country is intimate, tender, and brimming with the scope of Kurt Vonnegutâ€™s passions.
